name: legitimately
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is allowed by law: Most foreign visitors enter the country legitimately. We support legitimately elected governments.
in a way that is reasonable and acceptable: There are times when you legitimately need to cancel travel plans. Medicine is not an exact science and specialists can disagree legitimately on the best course of action.
More examplesFewer examplesThey had to decide whether the Marine had legitimately defended himself or committed a war crime.In the 2000 election, in some precincts in Florida, people who were legitimately registered were turned away at the polls.How can you be sure that a health records company will make your medical information available to people who legitimately need it while keeping it away from those who don't? If you were under duress and in danger, you could legitimately lie.
